intro: Epilobium kingdonii, commonly known as Kingdon's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it has a short, upright stem. Epilobium kingdonii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
